alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:41PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL SHERIDAN COUNTY THROUGH 1215 AM MDT... At 1140 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Spotted Horse, or 40 miles east of Sheridan, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail, wind gusts 40 to 45 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Torrential rainfall will cause a dramatic reduction in visibility. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Sheridan County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
